task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 151°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The current view only shows the lower part of the target building; looking up (increasing pitch) will allow me to see the roof, which is necessary to estimate the total height from ground to roof.

The current heading is 0°N, which is not aligned with the target building located at South-East (~151°); rotating right by 151 degrees will reorient the view to face the target building so I can observe its structure for height estimation.

Currently facing the target building but only viewing its lower portion; increasing the pitch by 30 degrees will allow me to see the upper sections and roof, which is essential for estimating the total height from ground to roof.

Current heading is 0°N, which is misaligned with the target building at 151°SE; rotating right by 151 degrees will reorient the view to face the target, allowing me to observe its full height once adjusted.

Currently facing the target building at 151°SE with a 0° pitch, I need to look up to view the full structure including the roof, so I will rotate the camera up by 30 degrees while maintaining the correct heading.

Current heading is 0°N, which is not aligned with the target building at 151°SE; rotating right by 151 degrees will reorient the view to face the target, and then I can adjust pitch to view the full structure.

Currently facing the target building at 151°SE with a 0° pitch, I need to look up to view the full structure including the roof, so I will rotate the camera up by 45 degrees while maintaining the current heading.

Current heading is 0°N, misaligned with the target building at 151°SE; rotating right by 151 degrees will reorient the view to face the target, allowing me to observe its full height with the adjusted pitch.

Currently facing the target building at 151°SE with a 0° pitch, I need to look up to view the full structure including the roof, so I will rotate the camera up by 30 degrees while maintaining the current heading.

I realize I was previously setting heading and pitch separately, causing misalignment; now I will set absolute heading to 151°SE and pitch to 30°UP in one rotation to face the target building and look up at its upper structure.

Now correctly facing the target residential building with an upward pitch, I can observe its full structure; estimating based on typical 3-meter floor height and ~8 visible floors, the total height is approximately 24 meters.
